author: Denise Pridgen
title: chevron-right
text: ASHEVILLE, N.C. (WLOS) â€” One person was injured in a shooting Saturday, Dec. 23, 2023, near Pisgah View Apartments. Asheville police said officers responded to a report of a shooting near the 30 block of Granada Street around 2:46 a.m. When officers arrived, they found a vehicle with multiple bullet holes, 37 shell casings in the area, but no gunshot victim. [VICTIM DIES AFTER CHRISTMAS EVE SHOOTING AT ASHEVILLE GAS STATION](https://wlos.com/news/local/victim-dies-after-christmas-eve-shooting-asheville-gas-station-greens-mini-mart-depot-street-mission-hospital-police-crime#) According to authorities, officers learned that a man suffering from non-life-threatening gunshot wounds to the arm and torso had been taken to Mission Hospital by a friend. Detectives are continuing to follow up on leads, an Asheville Police Department spokesperson said. [ASHEVILLE POLICE CLOSE OUT 2023 WITH 3 SHOOTINGS, 2 DEAD IN UNDER A WEEK; NO SUSPECTS IN CUSTODY](https://wlos.com/news/local/asheville-police-seek-information-publics-help-christmas-eve-shooting-gas-station-man-critical-condition-16-shell-casings-greens-mini-mart-update-no-suspects-custody) Asheville police ask anyone with information to come forward by sending an anonymous tip by texting TIP2APD to 847411 or by using the TIP2APD smartphone application (search "Asheville PD" in the app store). APD can also be contacted directly by calling 828-252-1110. ['GUN BATTLE' ON MYRTLE STREET INVOLVED PEOPLE IN TWO VEHICLES, ASHEVILLE POLICE SAY](https://wlos.com/news/local/gun-battle-on-myrtle-street-involved-people-in-two-cars-asheville-police-say-clarence-shivers-capt-joseph-silberman)
